intro: Ptarmica discoidea, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer, typically from June to August. The plant has a creeping stem with opposite leaves that are usually lance-shaped and hairy. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Ptarmica discoidea is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
